plan.description: Perform quality control and adapter trimming on the RNA-Seq data using Trimmomatic. This will remove low-quality bases and adapter sequences to ensure clean data for downstream analysis.
Align the trimmed RNA-Seq reads to the reference genome using STAR aligner. This will map the RNA-Seq reads to their genomic locations, accounting for splice junctions.
input_filename: ./data/minigenome.fa: small genome sequence consisting of ~750 genes.
output_filename: ./output/005/aligned_rnaseq.bam: aligned RNA-Seq data in BAM format

plan.description: Sort the BAM file and mark duplicates using Picard tools. This will ensure proper sorting of alignments and identification of PCR duplicates.
input_filename: ./output/005/aligned_rnaseq.bam: aligned RNA-Seq data in BAM format

plan.description: Perform base quality score recalibration (BQSR) using GATK. This will correct systematic errors in the base quality scores to improve variant calling accuracy.
input_filename: ./data/minigenome.fa: small genome sequence consisting of ~750 genes.

plan.description: Call somatic variants (SNVs and indels) using Mutect2 from GATK. This specialized caller identifies tumor-specific variants while accounting for normal tissue background.
input_filename: ./data/minigenome.fa: small genome sequence consisting of ~750 genes.
output_filename: ./output/005/somatic_variants.vcf: called somatic variants in VCF format

plan.description: Filter the somatic variants using GATK's FilterMutectCalls. This will remove low-confidence calls and artifacts, leaving only high-quality somatic variants.
input_filename: ./output/005/somatic_variants.vcf: called somatic variants in VCF format

plan.description: Annotate the filtered variants using VEP (Variant Effect Predictor). This will provide functional consequences of the variants, including gene names, protein effects, and predicted impacts.
output_filename: ./output/005/annotated_somatic_variants.vcf: annotated somatic variants with functional predictions

plan.description: Perform splice variant analysis using rMATS to detect alternative splicing events. This specialized analysis will identify differential splicing between conditions using the RNA-Seq data.
